summary:
Hans Bakker received his PhD in Physics and Mathematics in September 1985 from the Vrije Universiteit in Amsterdam. He joined Shell Research in its Amsterdam laboratory in October 1985 in the Materials Engineering department. His initial years in Shell were spend as a research physicist on developing inspection techniques for on-stream pipeline inspection. After various assignments in research and the business, engineering and operational experience was gathered via assignments in Singapore (area maintenance manager) and Pernis (production unit manager). In between, a job was held in consultancy in the fields of maintenance and inspection. Since 2002 Hans has been working in the projects department of Shell Global Solutions as a buiness manager. He has refurbished the Shell project management systems and was the originator of the Shell Project Academy. Based on his experience he was appointed to the chair of Management of Engineering Projects at the Delft University of Technology as a part-time professor in the summer of 2007. He has been Vice President for Contracting and Procurment and has recently taken up a special project to introduce the new way of working in the Shell offices in Rijswijk and Amsterdam.
The red line throughout his whole career has been change management and a clear focus on people. With effect from January 2015 he will be solely focussing on further developing the chair at TU Delft.

profile_positions.description: Lecturing on Management of Engineering Projects at Master level. Research focus is on the development of project management tools covering the whole chain from the development of sustainable process concepts in the laboratory through to the construction of plants combining cost leadership with a minimal ecological footprint. A second focus area will be the adaptability and scalability of project management tools for every phase of the project cycle from technology development through to construction. Special attention will be given in this field to the nature of the projects and the size of the executing companies and their role in the whole chain.
profile_positions.title: Professor Management of Engineering Projects

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Executive Vice President Human Resourcing. As project manager responsible for the redevelopment of the office buildings and the creation of a better connected working environment for 4000 staff spread over the two locations. Aim is to make better use of the available space and in the process reduce the number of leased floors where possible.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Winning Innovation

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Executive Vice President CP. Responsible for the development of the future Contracting and Procurement Strategy as well as Global Contract Management, Health, Safety and Environment and sustainable development management within contracts and the development of sustainable sourcing procedures fort the global supplier community (107.000 suppliers worldwide).
profile_positions.title: Vice President CP Strategy, HSE and SD

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Executive Vice President CP. Responsible for the development and execution of world-class commercially driven CP strategies, practices, standards and systems for projects of the Royal Dutch Shell Group aimed at sustainable competitive advantage. Managing and developing the Group CP Projects skill pool. Ensuring deep linkage with the wider CP strategies and activities, especially enterprise category management and supplier relationship management. Clear focus on developing longer term relationships with the EPC community to our mutual benefit.
profile_positions.title: Vice President CP Projects

profile_positions.description: Reporting to and deputy of the Vice President Projects. Responsible for the delivery of all capital investment projects above 10 million US dollars in Europe, Africa and the Middle East. Total staff of project engineers, senior project engineers and project managers of 134 people based in The Hague. Projects being executed for the main businesses: Downstream, Gas and Power and Non-Traditional Business (Renewables, Coal, Wind, CO2). Total number of projects around 200, with an annual budget of around 5 billion US dollars. Projects ranging from front end development to implementation and construction. Main focus is on managing the project portfolio, staff resourcing, staff development and change management. Besides this role also Global Discipline Head responsible for the competency and capability development of the staff in the global project skill pool.
profile_positions.title: Regional Operations Manager Projects

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Vice President Projects. Responsible for the global delivery of capital cost estimates, planning and scheduling and cost control for all the major Shell projects in both Downstream and Gas and Power with 55 staff spread over the globe. Focus on cost, schedule and commercial aspects. Started the alignment of both services organizations within Downstream and Upstream. Reorganised the project services delivery in a global setting and played a crucial role in improving the project delivery performance via a structured approach to project management (developed the ways of working) and the development and introduction of the accompanying organization. Developed the Shell Project Academy concept to guarantee the development of future generations of project managers within Shell. Designed and developed the academy pentagon model based on learning, experience, mentoring, networking and accreditation.
profile_positions.title: Global Manager Project Services

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Refinery Manager. Responsible for 170 fte’s, a budget of 72 million NLG and 44 production plants. Facilitating the change towards self-steered asset management teams. On top of that focused on Refinery Engineering Management Support. Supporting the production unit managers in realising best in class targets in the area of engineering and maintenance (contractor management and contractor safety).
profile_positions.title: Production Unit Manager

profile_positions.description: Reporting to Business Group Manager. Responsible for advising Shell and non-Shell refineries and third party industrial companies on the optimal way of maintaining their assets while preserving the integrity. Combining technical analysis with change management techniques to guarantee the acceptance of the suggested improvements at the staff level of the client company.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Maintenance and Inspection

profile_positions.description: Reporting to Engineering Manager. Responsible for day-to-day maintenance of half of the refinery as well as shutdown planning and management (60 staff). Responsible for three major shutdowns in that period in parallel to the day to day activities. One shutdown was combined with a major revamp project of the luboil plant. Focal point for HSE, IT and project leader for change management in the field of contractor safety for the whole of the refinery. Chairman of the Contractor Safety Committee. Developed and build a novel way of safety induction for less educated staff.
profile_positions.title: Area Maintenance Manager

profile_positions.description: Reporting to Director Facilities. Research support, workshops, utilities supply and facility management. Main attention to restructuring and rebuilding the organization after the major downsizing. Together with a working group of staff developed the final organizational model and the future way of working.
profile_positions.title: Department Head (act) Research and Institutional Support

profile_positions.description: Responsible for Change Management and Quality Support, at Royal Dutch/Shell Laboratories, Amsterdam (25 staff). Reporting to Department Head. Rebuilding the department that was downsized by 35% and setting a new direction for the facility management of the Amsterdam site. Development and implementation of a new Contracting Strategy. Major change management process with all its aspects.
profile_positions.title: Section Head Research and Institutional Support

profile_positions.description: Reporting to Division Head. Responsible for international standardization and material coding of the Shell Group (25 staff). Transformed in this period a paper based catalogue system to one of the first on CD-ROM. Developed an electronic spare part management system and took the lead in developing the next generation catalogue management tool based on text based search principles. Set the first steps towards decentralizing this activity. First activities in the field of Change Management focused on staff development.
profile_positions.title: Department Head Materials Management Services

profile_positions.description: Reporting to Engineering Director. Personal assistant to one of the Research Directors tasked with performing strategic studies (technology strategy for the Shell Group, research planning and budgeting, productivity study of the research process)
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Planner and General Management Assistant

profile_positions.description: Reporting to Section Head. Focus on electromagnetic techniques, ultrasonic techniques, acoustic emission and the application on various metallic materials and glass fibre reinforced composites. Charter was to use and apply various physical techniques and methods for the improvement of inspection methods and techniques for application in refineries, chemical plants, offshore installations and pipelines. Developed close relationships with suppliers and producers for the evaluation and application of various techniques having the potential for commercial application or already available.
profile_positions.title: Group Leader Inspection Technique Development

profile_positions.description: Reporting to workgroup leader. Development of industrial inspection techniques based on electromagnetic techniques. Special task to develop a potential inspection method for the inspection of the new duplex stainless steel material. Chosen to develop a technique for the generation of ultrasonic waves based on magnetostriction. Build a prototype showing the feasibility of the technique for the detection of cracks and pitting in duplex stainless steel in a laboratory environment. Besides this developed a new capacitive method for the inspection of heat exchanger tubes and patented this invention and been involved in the evaluation of commercially available systems and techniques before application in the field.
profile_positions.title: Research Physicist

volunteer_experiences.description: Hockey trainer and sports convenor for 42 nationalities.

volunteer_experiences.role: Charter Member Lions Club Amsterdam Oud-Zuid
volunteer_experiences.description: Organiser of the annual concert for disabled people in the Amsterdam Concertgbouw.
